content: pattern - checker square scarf checker square scarf design by hannah chen the checker square scarf is a great project for using up scrap yarn and is very beginner-friendly this project is worked entirely flat that means if you knit on the right side you will purl on the next wrong side row and if you purl on the right side you will knit on the following wrong side row to begin cast on your edge stitches and increase until you reach your preferred width once the scarf is as wide as you like continue knitting until it reaches your desired length then start decreasing to mirror the beginning this pattern is highly flexible simply adjust the number of increase stitches for the width and knit more or fewer row for the length to create the size that suits you best 1 pattern - checker square scarf size one size measurements approximately 91 cm in length and 6 cm at the widest point yarn fingering weight yarn note since gauge isn t crucial for this pattern any scrap yarn will work just remember to choose a needle size that suits your yarn so the fabric looks even and comfortable to knit needles dpns in size 3 6 mm jp5 tools tapestry needle gauge 10 sts x 10 row in stockinette stitch on needles 3 6 mm = 10 x 10 cm / 4 square abbreviations bobble = bind off rs = right side ws = wrong side st s = stitch es yo = yarn over double_crochet = decrease 1st using k2tog or p2tog k = knit p = purl kbl = knit st through the back loop 2 pattern - checker square scarf pbl = purl st through the back loop k2tog = knit 2sts together p2tog = purl 2sts together edge sts = slip 1st purl wise with yarn held in the front knit 1st method step 1 set up cast on 4 sts using dpns start from ws as following row 1 ws edge sts for total 2 times row 2 rs edge sts for total 2 times row3 ws edge sts for total 2 times step 2 increasing row1 rs edge sts yo edge sts row2 ws edge sts pbl edge sts row3 rs edge sts k edge sts row4 ws edge sts p edge sts row5 rs edge sts yo p edge sts row6 ws edge sts k kbl edge sts row7 rs edge sts p p edge sts pattern figure row8 ws edge sts k k edge sts row9 rs edge sts k k yo edge sts row10 ws edge sts pbl p p edge sts row11 rs edge sts k k k edge sts row12 ws edge sts p p p edge sts continue increasing after the first edge sts and before the last edge sts on every increase row in other words repeat row5 12 which add a total of 2 sts per full repeat until you reach your desired width the
